hanzi-su-wiki:
爪

Значения

Ноготь, коготь

🔑87

Мнемоника

Когти на пальцах, расположенные щепотью и обращённые вниз.

Описание

Нога птицы с тремя вытянутыми когтями напоминает уже знакомый нам иероглиф «рука», повернутый вниз.

В сочетании с иероглифом «зуб» ключ образует выражение «зуб и коготь», что во время иностранной оккупации Китая означало «заносчивый прислужник европейцев». Соединяя иероглифы «коготь» и «боа» (толстая змея, которая водится на юге Китая), получаем «ползать». Это сложное слово в сочетании с иероглифом «насекомое» дает слово «рептилия»: китайцы снова объединяют насекомых и змей, игнорируя их разное происхождение. В соединении с иероглифом «смотреть» этот ключ образует глагол «преследовать, гнаться». Напишите этот ключ после иероглифа «гора» и получите глагол «взбираться».

爪牙 прислужник, лакей
爬 ползать
爬虫 рептилия
觅 преследовать

(колл.) ступня животного или птицы; (колл.) ступня поддерживает кастрюлю и т. д.

purpleculture_examples:
爪子 [ zhuǎ zi ]: (animal's) claw
一鳞半爪 [ yī lín bàn zhuǎ ]: lit. one scale and half a claw (idiom); only odd bits and pieces
爪儿 [ zhuǎ r ]: paws (of small animal); same as 爪子 ; legs of furniture or apparatus; stupid person
飞鸿雪爪 [ fēi hóng xuě zhuǎ ]: see 雪泥鸿爪
鹰爪翻自拳 [ yīng zhuǎ fān zi quán ]: Ying Zhua Fan Zi Quan - "Eagle Claw" - Martial Art

heisig_story: This character is a pictograph of a bird's claw, and from there comes to mean animal claws in general (including human fingernails).
koohiiStory1: A pictograph of Wolverine´s adamantium claws.
koohiiStory2: Pictograph, see book. * I prefer the primitive meaning of an eagle rather than vulture. Somehow vulture makes me think more about meat and dead corpses than claws. An eagle however immediately brings to my mind the image of an eagle plunging into a stream catching fish in his claws, or that of the great eagles rescuing Bilbo and his party in Jrr Tolkien´s novel “Bilbo the Hobbit”.
jp_example_words: 爪(つめ): fingernail or toenail, claw, talon, hoof
WaniKani_Meaning_Mnemonic: The claw radical and the claw kanji are exactly the same! Ravishing!
WaniKani_Reading_Mnemonic: You’ve got not one tumor (つま), but too many (つめ) tumors and you need to claw them out with your sharp claw. One tumor is one tumor too many. Cut them out with your claw!
WaniKani_Reading_Info: Imagine you have too many tumors. Feel the claw digging into your flesh and removing the tumors. It really hurts, but it is necessary.

humanum_full_description_en:
Elaboration: The downward hand of the oracle bone inscription , that is, the shape of the covering hand. The inscription " claw " from the hand from ◎, like a hand, ◎ like a sharp finger claw. Can be understood as the fingers of birds, animals or people.

"Shuowen": "Chang Ye, cover your hands and call claws." " Chun " has the meaning of holding, so " claws " also mean to take. The characters " claws " in oracle bones and inscriptions are rarely seen, and they are often used as parts, such as " Fang ", which resembles the shape of a covering hand to show that the hand is used to fetch objects. There is the term "minions" in the bronze inscriptions, using sharp claws and fangs as a metaphor to indicate powerful military officials. Shi Kezhen: "Defend (defend) the (imperial) king's body, turn (make) the minions." "Poetry. "Pray for Father": "Pray for Father! To the king's minions." "Zuo Zhuan. "Twelve Years of Cheng Gong": "Thinking that one's heart, thighs, and claws." After adding hands, the word " grabbing " is added, which means grabbing . " Claw " and " ugly " are the same, refer to " ugly " and " fork ".
humanum_short_description_en: Synopsis: The downward hand of the oracle bone inscription , that is, the shape of the covering hand. The inscription " claw " from the hand from ◎, like a hand, ◎ like a sharp finger claw. Can be understood as the fingers of birds, animals or people.
humanum_full_description:
甲骨文象向下的手，即覆手之形。金文「爪」從手從◎，象手形，◎象鋒利的指爪。可理解為鳥獸或人的指爪。

　　《說文》：「丮也，覆手曰爪。」「丮」有執持之義，故「爪」亦有拿取之意。甲骨、金文「爪」字少見，多用作部件，如「爫」，象覆手之形，以示覆手取物。金文中有「爪牙」一語，以鋒爪利牙來作比喻，表示得力之武臣。師克盨：「干(捍)害(禦)王身，乍(作)爪牙。」《詩．祈父》：「祈父！予王之爪牙。」《左傳．成公十二年》：「以為己腹心、股肱、爪牙。」後加手累增「抓」字，表示擒拿。「爪」、「丑」形同，參「丑」、「叉」。
humanum_short_description: 甲骨文象向下的手，即覆手之形。金文「爪」從手從◎，象手形，◎象鋒利的指爪。可理解為鳥獸或人的指爪。

爪(つめ): fingernail or toenail, claw, talon, hoof

甲骨文象向下的手，即覆手之形。金文「 爪 」從手從◎，象手形，◎象鋒利的指爪。可理解為鳥獸或人的指爪。 《說文》：「丮也，覆手曰爪。」「 丮 」有執持之義，故「 爪 」亦有拿取之意。甲骨、金文「 爪 」字少見，多用作部件，如「 爫 」，象覆手之形，以示覆手取物。金文中有「爪牙」一語，以鋒爪利牙來作比喻，表示得力之武臣。師克盨：「干(捍)害(禦)王身，乍(作)爪牙。」《詩．祈父》：「祈父！予王之爪牙。」《左傳．成公十二年》：「以為己腹心、股肱、爪牙。」後加手累增「 抓 」字，表示擒拿。「 爪 」、「 丑 」形同，參「 丑 」、「 叉 」。
Elaboration: The downward hand of the oracle bone inscription, that is, the shape of the covering hand. The inscription " claw" from the hand from ◎, like a hand, ◎ like a sharp finger claw. Can be understood as the fingers of birds, animals or people. "Shuowen": "Chang Ye, cover your hands and call claws." " Chun" has the meaning of holding, so " claws" also mean to take. The characters " claws" in oracle bones and inscriptions are rarely seen, and they are often used as parts, such as " Fang", which resembles the shape of a covering hand to show that the hand is used to fetch objects. There is the term "minions" in the bronze inscriptions, using sharp claws and fangs as a metaphor to indicate powerful military officials. Shi Kezhen: "Defend (defend) the (imperial) king's body, turn (make) the minions." "Poetry. "Pray for Father": "Pray for Father! To the king's minions." "Zuo Zhuan. "Twelve Years of Cheng Gong": "Thinking that one's heart, thighs, and claws." After adding hands, the word " grabbing" is added, which means grabbing. " Claw" and " ugly" are the same, refer to " ugly" and " fork".

爪字的基本解释

爪
zhǎo
指甲或趾甲：趾端有爪。
鸟兽的脚指：鹰爪。爪牙（喻党羽，狗腿子）。一鳞半爪。
抓。

爪
zhuǎ
禽兽的脚（多指有尖甲的）：鸡爪子。狗爪子。
像爪的东西，这个锅有三个爪儿。

爪字的汉语字典释义

[①]［zhuǎ］［zhǎo］
［《廣韻》側絞切，上巧，莊。］
“搔3”的被通假字。“蚤2”的被通假字。
(1)鸟兽的趾端有尖甲的脚。亦指其尖利趾甲。
(2)引申指器物的爪形部分。
(3)人的指甲。亦指手指或手。
(4)剪指甲或趾甲。
(5)用指甲掐。
(6)喻护卫者。
(7)抓，搔。
(8)捕捉。
(9)犹言傻。
(10)同“找”。参见“爪尋”。

爪字的英文翻译

◎ 爪
armature, claw, talon, unguis

爪字的康熙字典解释

【巳集中】【爪字部】　爪； 康熙笔画：4； 页码：页688第26
〔古文〕㕚【唐韻】【集韻】?側絞切，音抓。【說文】覆手曰爪。【詩·小雅】祈父子王之爪牙。【周禮·冬官考工記·梓人】凡攫閷援簭之類，必深其爪，出其目，作其鱗之而。【廣韻】手足甲也。【集韻】本作㕚。或作蚤搔。◎按韻會云：說文爪本爲抓爪之爪，非手足甲也。亦太迂泥，不可从。　又【集韻】【類篇】?阻敎切，音笊。【集韻】覆手取物。一曰扟也。

爪字的源字形

爪字的起名意思

指禽兽的脚（多指有尖甲的），后也指像爪的东西。

claw
Basic explanation of words
claw
zhǎo
Nail or toenail: There are claws at the end of the toe.
The toes of birds and beasts: eagle claws. Minions (Yu Dangyu, dog legs). A scale and half claws.
Grab.
claw
zhuǎ
Animal's feet (many fingers with pointed armor): chicken paws. Dog paw.
Something like claws, this pot has three claws.
claw
Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①] [zhuǎ] [zhǎo]
["Guangyun" side-cut, Qiao, Zhuang. ]
"Scratch 3" was passed falsely. "Flea 2" is a false word.
(1) Birds and animals have pointed toes on their toes. Also refers to its sharp toenails.
(2) By extension, it refers to the claw-shaped part of the utensil.
(3) Human nails. Also refers to fingers or hands.
(4) Cut nails or toenails.
(5) Pinched with nails.
(6) Yu the guardian.
(7) Grab and scratch.
(8) Capture.
(9) Still stupid.
(10) Same as "find". See "Claw Search".
claw

[Said Wen] Cover your hands and say claws. 【Poetry·Xiaoya】Pray for the minions of father and son. 【Zhou Li·Dongguan Kao Gong Ji·Zi Ren】Anyone who grabs a handicraft or the like must deepen their claws, get out of their eyes, and make their scales. [Guang Yun] Arms and feet. 【Ji Yun】This is a 㕚. Or as a flea scratch. ◎According to the rhyme, it will be said that the claw is originally the claw of the grasping claw, not the hand and foot. It's too roundabout to follow.　[Ji Yun] [Class Chapter]? Blocking cut, sound 笊. [Jiyun] Cover your hands and fetch things. One said that it is too.

E EK
коготь
zhăo, zhuă
коготь
коготь
«Шуовэнь»: «прикрытие рук, ртов и когтей».
Обучающий образ похож на человеческую руку, схватившую предметы, но упрощенную до трех пальцев.
Форма руки может быть подтверждена такими словами, как «взять», «быть», «любить», «получить», «направлять» и «ан».
Позже это называлось «человеческие ногти или ногти на ногах» и «ноги черного зверя».
E EK
zhǎo, zhuǎ
I сущ.
1) коготь, ноготь
虎爪 когти тигра
2) лапа
狗用后爪挠耳朵 собака чешет задней лапой за ухом
3) техн. лапа, ножка
铁锚四爪皆折 четыре лапы якоря сломаны
三爪儿锅 котёл на трёх ножках
4) медиатор, роговая косточка (для игры на щипковых муз. инструментах)
弹筝者以鹿角为爪弹之 играющий на цитре пользуется медиатором из оленьего рога
II гл.
1) чесать; скрести, скоблить
爪其肤以验其生枯 соскоблить (у дерева) кору, чтобы проверить, живое оно или омертвело
2) подрезать ногти
小臣爪足 прислужник обрезает ногти на ногах
